question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.1 End Of Unit Assessment'.

question.name: A school has a toy drive for a holiday in...
question.questiontext:
A school has a toy drive for a holiday in which students bring in toys to be donated to charity. The number of toys donated by juniors and seniors are summarized in the histograms.

Is the standard deviation of number of toys donated greater for seniors or juniors?

question.name: Diego arranges his math class from shortest to tallest and...
question.questiontext:
Diego arranges the students in his math class from shortest to tallest and measures the height in inches of each student in the class. The heights of the 22 shortest students are summarized in the histogram. The tallest 8 students have their heights recorded here.

  • 73
  • 73
  • 73
  • 75
  • 75
  • 77
  • 79
  • 81
  1. Complete the histogram using the data for the tallest 8 students in the class.
  2. Use the shape of the distribution to compare the mean and median. Are the mean and median equal? If not, which is greater? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: The chess club at a school has 15 members. The...
question.questiontext:
The chess club at a school has 15 members. The number of games won in tournament play this season by each member is listed.

  • 6
  • 6
  • 6
  • 7
  • 10
  • 11
  • 12
  • 13
  • 14
  • 14
  • 15
  • 16
  • 18
  • 18
  • 30
  1. Create a box plot of the data.
  2. What measure of center is most appropriate to use to describe a typical value for the data in this distribution? Explain your reasoning.
  3. What measure is most appropriate for describing variability in this data distribution?

question.name: The histograms and summary statistics summarize the data for the...
question.questiontext:
The histograms and summary statistics summarize the data for the number of hits in the season by baseball players in two leagues.

Some summary statistics for the number of hits by players in each league.

meanmedianstandard deviationminimumQ1Q3maximum
league A151.1214826.8329136167207
league B163.2515724.93136145178256
  1. Use the shape of the distributions to select the appropriate measures of center and variability for the number of hits by players in each of the two leagues. Compare the number of hits by players in the two leagues using these measures. Explain what each value means in your comparison.
  2. Each data set contains one outlier. What are the values of the two outliers? Explain how each value is determined to be an outlier.
  3. Elena suggests removing the outliers from each data set because they are so unusual. Is this the right action to take? Explain your reasoning.
  4. If the outliers are removed, which would be more likely to change significantly: the mean or the median? Is the standard deviation or interquartile range more likely to change significantly? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: The dot plots show 9 scores on a 10 question...
question.questiontext: The dot plots show 9 scores on a 10 question trivia game for two students. Select all the statements that must be true.

answer.answertext: Noah's scores have greater variability than Jada's scores.
The standard deviation of Noah's scores is equal to the standard deviation of Jada's scores.
The mean of Noah's scores is greater than the mean of Jada's scores.
Noah scored better than Jada on every assignment.
Using only Noah's scores, the mean is equal to the median.

question.name: The dot plots show the salaries for the employees at...
question.questiontext:
The dot plots show the salaries for the employees at two small companies before a new company head is hired at each company.

Select all the statements that must be true.

answer.answertext: The mean and median values of salaries shown in the dot plot for company 2 are the same.
The standard deviation of salaries shown in the dot plot for company 2 is greater than the standard deviation of salaries at company 1.
The median values of salaries shown in the dot plots for the two companies are about the same.
The median value of salaries at company 1 will remain unchanged after a company head is hired to have a salary of 500 thousand dollars.
The new company head with a salary of 500 thousand dollars will affect the mean value for salaries at company 2 more than the median value for salaries at company 2.

question.name: The two box plots summarize the number of hours spent...
question.questiontext: The two box plots summarize the number of hours spent in the weight room for all the players on the football team for two different high schools. Which of the statements must be true about the distribution of data represented in the boxplots?

answer.answertext: Players at school 1 typically spent more time in the weight room than players at school 2.
The middle half of the data for school 1 has more variability than the middle half of the data for school 2.
The median hours spent in the weight room for school 1 is less than the median for school 2 and the interquartile ranges for both schools are equal.
The total number of hours spent in the weight room for players at school 2 is greater than the total number of hours for players at school 1.

Solve the system of equations. Explain or show your reasoning.

question.name: A pizza shop sells pizzas that are 10 inches or...
question.questiontext:
A pizza shop sells pizzas that are 10 inches (in diameter) or larger. A 10-inch cheese pizza costs $8. Each additional inch costs $1.50, and each additional topping costs $0.75.

Write an equation that represents the cost of a pizza. Be sure to specify what the variables represent.

question.name: Consider this system of equations: \(\displaystyle \begin{cases} y=\frac{9-x}{2} \\3x-4y=12...
question.questiontext: Consider this system of equations: \( \displaystyle \begin{cases} y=\text-\frac{1}{2}x + 4\frac12 \\ 3x-4y=12 \end{cases} \) Solve the system by graphing. Label each graph and the solution.

question.name: Solve the system of equations exactly. Show your reasoning.\(\displaystyle...
question.questiontext: Solve the system of equations without graphing. Show your reasoning. \( \displaystyle \begin{cases} 2y=x-4 \\ 4x+3y=5 \end{cases} \)

question.name: The system of equations... has exactly one (x,y) pair for its solution
question.questiontext:
The system of equations \( \begin{cases} 4x+6y=24\\ 2x+y=8 \end{cases} \) has exactly one \( (x,y) \) pair for its solution.

  1. If we double each side of the second equation, \( 2x+y=8 \), we have \( 4x+2y=16 \). Explain why the same \( (x,y) \) pair that is the solution to the system is also a solution to this new equation.

    If needed, you can support your explanation with hanger diagrams, or by inventing a situation that the equations represent.

  2. If we add the two equations in the original system, we have \( 6x +7y=32 \). Explain why the same \( (x,y) \) pair is also a solution to this equation.

    Again, you can support your explanation with diagrams or a situation, if needed.

question.name: A phone company charges a base fee of \$12 per...
question.questiontext:
A phone company charges a base fee of $12 per month plus an additional charge per minute. The monthly phone cost \( C \) can be represented by this equation: \( C=12+a \cdot m \), where \( a \) is the additional charge per minute, and \( m \) is the number of minutes used.

Which equation can be used to find the number of minutes a customer used if we know \( a \) and \( C \)?

question.name: Consider the equation \(\frac{(5x+6)}2=3-(4x+12)\). Select equations that each could be...
question.questiontext: Select all equations that are equivalent to \( \frac{(5x+6)}2=3-(4x+12) \).

question.name: Tickets to the zoo cost 12 dollars for adults...
question.questiontext:
Tickets to the zoo cost $12 for adults and $8 for children. The school has a budget of $240 for the field trip. An equation representing the budget for the trip is \( 240=12x+8y \). Here is a graph of this equation.

Select all the true statements.

answer.answertext: If no adult chaperones were needed, 30 students could go to the zoo.
If ten students go to the zoo, then 15 adults can go.
If four more adults go to the zoo, that means there will be room for six fewer students.
If two more students go to the zoo, that means there will be room for three fewer adults.
If 16 adults go to the zoo, then 6 students can go.

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2 End Of Unit Assessment'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2 End Of Unit Assessment'.

question.name: A hairstylist charges \$15 for an adult haircut and \$9...
question.questiontext:
A hairstylist charges $15 for an adult haircut and $9 for a child haircut. She wants to earn at least $360 dollars and cut a maximum of 30 haircuts this week. The graphs represent the hairstylist's constraints.

List two points that could represent the numbers of adult and child haircuts that meet the hairstylist's goals.

question.name: A jewelry artist is selling necklaces at an art fair
question.questiontext:
A jewelry artist is selling necklaces at an art fair. It costs $135 to rent a booth at the fair. The cost of materials for each necklace is $4.50. The artist is selling the necklaces at $12 each.

The inequality \( 12n > 135 + 4.50n \) represents the situation in which the artist makes a profit.

  1. Will the artist make a profit if she sells 15 necklaces? Show how you know.
  2. Write an inequality to show the number of necklaces, \( n \), the artist must sell to make a profit. Show your reasoning.

question.name: A student has started a lawn care business. He charges...
question.questiontext:
A student has started a lawn care business. He charges $15 per hour to mow lawns and $20 per hour for gardening. Because he is still in school, he is only allowed to work for at most 20 hours per week. His goal is to make at least $300 per week.

  1. Create a system of equations or inequalities that models the situation. Define the variables you use.
  2. The graph shows one of the relevant equations in this situation. Draw the graph of the other relevant equation.

  3. Show all the points that represent the number of hours the student can work at each job and meet his goal.

question.name: Graph the solution to the inequality
question.questiontext: Graph the solution to the inequality \( 4x+5y<20 \).

question.name: Consider the inequality Which...
question.questiontext: Consider the inequality \( \displaystyle \frac{x+3}6 > \frac {x}{4} +1 \). Which value of \( x \) is a solution to the inequality?

question.name: Select the graph that represents the solution to the inequality...
question.questiontext: Which graph represents the solution to this system of inequalities? \( \begin {cases} 3x-5y \leq 15\\ y \gt \text- \frac 23 x+1 \end {cases} \)

question.name: The gardening club at school is growing vegetables. The club...
question.questiontext:
The gardening club at school is growing vegetables. The club has 300 square feet of planting beds. Cucumber plants require 6 square feet of growing space, and tomato plants require 4 square feet of growing space. The students want to plant some of each type of plant and have at least 60 plants.

Select all the equations or inequalities that could describe this situation. Let \( c \) represent the number of cucumber plants and \( t \) represent the number of tomato plants.

question.name: Diego is interested in investigating whether there is an association...
question.questiontext:
Diego is investigating whether there is an association between wearing sneakers and participating on an athletic team. This table summarizes the data he collected.

on athletic teamnot on athletic teamtotal
wear sneakers121830
don't wear sneakers243660
total365490

Is there evidence of an association between the variables? Explain how you know.

question.name: Draw a linear model that fits the data well for...
question.questiontext:
1. Draw a linear model that fits the data well for the data in this scatter plot.
  2. Explain why this linear model fits the data well.

question.name: Elena surveyed her schoolmates about whether they have an unlimited...
question.questiontext:
Elena surveyed her schoolmates about whether they have an unlimited data phone plan and whether they believe they spend a lot of time on their phones. Complete the missing entries in this two-way table.

a lot of time on the phonenot a lot of time on the phonetotal
unlimited data10
don't have unlimited data32
total8453

question.name: Teams of various sizes are asked to work on a...
question.questiontext:
Teams of various sizes are asked to work on a puzzle. Researchers record how many members are in the team and how long it takes the team to complete the puzzle. This scatter plot represents their data.

  1. Does the relationship between the size of the team and completion time appear to be a negative relationship, positive relationship, or not a relationship? Explain your reasoning.
  2. Would a linear model be a good way to describe the relationship between the size of the team and completion time? If not, explain your reasoning. If so, draw a line that would fit the data well.

question.name: The scatter plot shows the median household income, \(x\), in...
question.questiontext:
The scatter plot shows the median household income, \( x \), in thousands of dollars, and the number of adults per 1,000 people with bachelor's degrees, \( y \), of 50 U.S. states. The line \( y=4.08x+63.13 \) is a good fit for this data.

\( y = 4.08x+63.13 \)

  1. What is the slope of the line fit to the data? What does it mean in this situation?
  2. Mississippi has the lowest median income at 40.6 thousand dollars. Mississippi also has about 207 bachelor's degrees per 1,000 people. What does the linear model estimate for the number of bachelor's degrees per 1,000 people for Mississippi based on the median income? How good is this estimate?

question.name: A Student Surveyed 100 Adults Who Took Either Vitamin C,... (Short Answer Response)
question.questiontext:
A student surveyed 100 adults who took either vitamin C, zinc, or echinacea supplements to prevent getting a cold. The adults were asked if they had a cold or no cold in the last 30 days. The results are shown in the table.

no coldcoldtotal
vitamin C411556
zinc12517
echinacea21627
total7426100
  1. What proportion of adults in the survey took echinacea?
  2. What proportion of adults who took vitamin C reported having a cold in the last 30 days?
  3. What proportion of adults who reported having a cold took zinc?

question.name: Kiran collects data about the amount of water a person...
question.questiontext:
Kiran collects data about the number of trees on school property and the average standardized test scores for those schools. Kiran says, "The scatter plot between the number of trees on a school property and student standardized tests scores shows a strong and positive correlation. An increase in the number of trees on school property causes the students to score better on standardized tests."

  1. What does it mean for the relationship between the variables when the correlation is strong in this situation?
  2. What does it mean for the relationship between the variables when the correlation is positive in this situation?
  3. What is wrong with the last sentence of Kiran's statement? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: One part of Clare’s job at an environmental awareness organization...
question.questiontext:
One part of Clare's job at an environmental awareness organization is to answer the phone to collect donations. The table shows the number of hours she worked each week, \( x \), and the amount of donations in dollars, \( y \), that the organization collected each week for 10 weeks.

hours worked (\( x \))donations in dollars (\( y \))residual
10162
12180
20280
15231
6115
10160
12195
15220
25339
8128

The data in the scatter plot suggest a linear association. A line to model the data is given by \( y = 12x+41 \).

  1. Use the given linear model to complete the table with the residuals.
  2. Is the line given a reasonably good fit? Explain your reasoning.
  3. Explain the meaning of the slope of the line in this situation.
  4. Describe the correlation between the variables as either strong or weak and as either positive or negative. Explain your reasoning.
  5. Clare's boss sees the graph and tells her, "We certainly tend to bring in a lot more money when you're working here! This graph proves you're the cause of this increase in donations!" Do you agree with Clare's boss? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: The purchasing habits of 1,000 grocery shoppers were noted. No...
question.questiontext:
The purchasing habits of 1,000 grocery shoppers are noted. No association is found between the variables. Fill in the empty portion of the table with values that would support this claim. Explain your reasoning.

bought milkno milk bought
bought eggs422228
no eggs bought

question.name: A company that makes scarves has many different styles and...
question.questiontext:
A company that makes scarves has many different styles and colors that people can order. The company keeps track of the number of each style, color combination they make, and the average sale price for the scarves having that combination. They create a scatter plot using the data with the number of scarves along the \( x \)-axis and the average price per scarf, in dollars, along the \( y \)-axis.

The data in the graph suggest a linear association. Which of the functions best represents the equation of the line of best fit?

question.name: Twenty-one young men got a quote for car insurance policy...
question.questiontext:
\( y = \text{-}315.67x+8986.5 \)

\( r = -0.951 \)

Twenty-one young men got a quote for the cost of a car insurance policy. The policy cost and ages of the men are shown in the scatter plot. Select all the statements that are true based on the scatter plot.

answer.answertext: Every 19-year-old in this group has a lower cost of car insurance than the 18-year-olds.
Car insurance policy cost tends to decrease as age of the driver increases.
The value of the correlation coefficient is very close to -1, so there is no association between age and car insurance policy cost.
The line of best fit indicates that, in general, the cost of a car insurance policy for a 21-year-old should be, on average, about $315 less than the cost of a car insurance policy for a 20-year-old.
The \( y \)-intercept from the line of best fit indicates that, if the linear trend holds, a car insurance policy would be $0 for a person who is about 8,987 years old.

question.name: Which of these graphs represents the residuals for a scatter plot that is fit well by a linear model?
question.questiontext: Which of these graphs represents the residuals for a scatter plot that is fit well by a linear model?

  2. \( |\text-4| = 4 \)
  3. \( |\text-4| = \text-4 \)
  4. \( |\text-4|=|4| \)

question.name: Pre.4 The graph shows the time, \(t\) it took a runner...
question.questiontext:
The graph shows the time, \( t \), it took a runner to run different distances, \( d \).

  1. How long did it take the runner to run 9 meters?
  2. How far did the runner go in 6 seconds?
  3. What does the point \( (24,8) \) on the graph mean in this situation?

question.name: Pre.5 Find the slope
question.questiontext: Find the slope of the line.

question.name: Pre.6 The graph shows the temperature between noon and midnight one...
question.questiontext:
The graph shows the temperature between noon and midnight one day in a certain city.

  1. What was the temperature at 9 p.m.?
  2. When was the temperature increasing?
  3. When was the temperature 55 degrees?
  4. Is temperature a function of time? Explain your reasoning.
  5. Is time a function of temperature? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: Pre.7 Jada opens a 5-kg bag of dog food and fills...
question.questiontext: Jada opens a 5-kg bag of dog food and fills her dog's dish with 0.25 kg of the content once a day. Write an equation for the amount of dog food left in the bag, \( W \) (kg), after she fills her dog's dish \( n \) times.

question.name: Pre.9 Mai is going for a walk. She is walking at...
question.questiontext:
Mai is going for a walk. She walks at a constant speed for 20 minutes. She takes a break for 5 minutes before turning around and walking back home. She walks faster than she did before.

  1. Sketch a graph that represents Mai's distance from home (miles) as a function of time (minutes).
  2. Label two points on the graph and explain what Mai is doing at the corresponding times.

question.name: Pre.3 Select all the points that are on the graph representing...
question.questiontext: Select all the points that are on the graph of the function defined by \( y=2x+3 \).

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.4 Mid Unit Assessment'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.4 Mid Unit Assessment'.

question.name: Mid.Rev.3 A Dropped Ball
question.questiontext:
A ball bounces several times after it is dropped. The graph shows the height of the ball over time.

Height is measured in meters and time is measured in seconds.

Select all statements that are true about the graph and the situation it represents.

answer.answertext: The vertical intercept shows the time when the ball hits the ground.
The vertical intercept shows when the ball is dropped.
The function reaches its maximum value after the first bounce.
The function has the maximum value at the vertical intercept.
The horizontal intercepts of the graph show the times when the ball hit the ground.
There are multiple times when the function is at its minimum value.

question.name: Mid.Rev.4 Amount of Rain
question.questiontext:
Function \( R \) gives the amount of rain measured by a rain gauge \( t \) hours since it started raining. The amount of rain is measured in millimeters.

  1. What does each expression or equation represent in this situation?
    1. \( R(3) \)
    2. \( R(0.5) = 14 \)
  2. Use function notation to represent each statement.
    1. Six hours after it started raining, the amount of rain was 37 millimeters.
    2. The amount of rain 90 minutes after it started raining was the same as the amount 120 minutes after it started raining.

question.name: Mid.Rev.5 Populations of Two Cities
question.questiontext:
Functions \( A \) and \( B \) give the population of City A and City B, respectively, \( t \) years since 1990. In each function, population is measured in millions.

Here are the graphs of the two functions.

  1. Which function value is greater: \( A(4) \) or \( B(4) \)?
  2. Are there one or more values of \( t \) at which the equation \( A(t)=B(t) \) is true? If so, which one or which ones?
  3. Identify at least two values of \( t \) at which the inequality \( B(t) is true.

question.name: Mid.Rev.6 Rice in a Restaurant
question.questiontext:
The owner of a small restaurant bought 75 kilograms of rice. Each week, the restaurant uses 4.5 kilograms of rice.

Function \( r \) gives the remaining amount of rice, in kilograms, as a function of the number of weeks since the restaurant owner bought the rice.

  1. Complete the table.
    weekskilograms of rice left
    6
    12
    \( w \)
  2. Use function notation to write a rule that defines function \( r \).
  3. On the coordinate plane, sketch a graph of function \( r \).
  4. Solve the equation \( r(w)=30 \) and explain what the solution means in this situation.

question.name: Mid.Rev.7 Population
question.questiontext:
The table and the graph show the population of a country between 2010 and 2015.

yearpopulation (millions)
201036.5
201137.7
201238.2
201338.4
201438.9
201539.1

  1. Find the average rate of population growth between 2010 and 2015.
  2. The average rate of population growth between 2013 and 2015 is 0.35 million people per year. If the population continues to grow at this rate, in which year will it reach 40 million? Explain your reasoning.
  3. How does the average rate of change of the population from 2013 to 2015 compare to that from 2011 to 2013? Explain what this means in terms of the population of the country.

question.name: Mid.Rev.1 Weight of a Cat
question.questiontext:
Function \( w \) gives the weight of a cat, in kilograms, when it is \( m \) months old.

Which statement represents the meaning of the equation \( w(7)=4 \) in this situation?

answer.answertext: The cat weighs 7 kilograms when it is 4 months old.
The cat weighs 4 kilograms when it is 7 months old.
The weight of the cat has been 7 kilograms for 4 months.
The cat weighs 4 kilograms when it is 7 years old.

question.name: Mid.Rev.2 Boat
question.questiontext:
Function \( d \) gives the distance of a boat from the dock \( t \) seconds after leaving the dock. Distance is measured in meters.

Here is a graph that represents \( d \).

Select all statements in function notation that represent the situation.

answer.answertext: \( d(t)=10 \) when \( t \) is 20.

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.4 End Of Unit Assessment'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.4 End Of Unit Assessment'.

question.name: End.Rev.2 Temperature in a Lab
question.questiontext:
To conduct an experiment, the room temperature in a lab needs to be as close as possible to -2 degrees Celsius. Any variation from this target temperature, whether warmer or cooler, is considered an error that could affect the experiment.

Function \( v \) gives the absolute temperature error as a function of the room temperature in degrees Celsius, \( x \).

Select all statements that are true about the function and the situation.

answer.answertext: When the room temperature is 0 degrees Celsius, \( v(0) \) has a value of 2.
When the room temperature is -3 degrees Celsius, the absolute temperature error, \( v(\text-3) \), is -1.
When the room temperature is 3 degrees Celsius, \( v(3) \) is 5.
The equation \( v(x)=|x-2| \) gives us the absolute temperature error when the room temperature is \( x \) degrees Celsius.
When \( v(x)= 0.5 \), the room temperature could be -1.5 or -2.5 degrees Celsius.
The equation \( v(x)=|x+2| \) gives us the absolute temperature error when the room temperature is \( x \) degrees Celsius.

question.name: End.Rev.3 Graph of Absolute Value Function
question.questiontext:
Here is the graph that represents a function.

Which equation represents the function?

question.name: End.Rev.4 Car & Distance Traveled
question.questiontext:
The equation \( m=40g \) gives the distance in miles, \( m \), that a car can travel using \( g \) gallons of gas.

  1. If the car has gone 140 miles, how much gas was used?
  2. Write an equation that represents the inverse function: the gallons of gas as a function of distance in miles.

question.name: End.Rev.5 Party Prices
question.questiontext:
The cost of holding a children's birthday party at a rollerskating rink is a function of \( n \), the number of people in the party. The cost function, \( C \), can be represented with this set of rules:

\( C(n)= \begin{cases} 150, & 0

  1. How much does it cost to have a party with 9 people? What about 20 people?
  2. Graph the function on the coordinate plane.

question.name: End.Rev.6 Gym Cost
question.questiontext:
Function \( c \) is defined by the equation \( c(n) = 50 + 4n \). It gives the monthly cost, in dollars, of visiting a gym as a function of the number of visits, \( n \).

  1. In this situation, what information would the inverse function give us?
  2. Find the inverse function.
  3. Find the value of \( c(7) \). Show your reasoning and explain what the value means in this situation.

question.name: End.Rev.7 Movie Theater Passes
question.questiontext:
A movie theater is offering a special summer pass. Passholders pay $8 per movie for the first 5 movies and watch additional movies for free, up to a maximum of 15 movies. The function \( C \) gives the total cost, in dollars, for a passholder to watch \( n \) movies.

  1. Is function \( C \) a piecewise function? Explain your reasoning.
  2. Draw a graph to represent \( C \).
  3. Describe, as completely as possible, the domain of \( C \).
  4. Describe, as completely as possible, the range of \( C \).

question.name: End.Rev.1 People in the Library
question.questiontext:
Function \( p \) represents the number of people in the library on a Monday as a function of hours since the library opened.

Here is the graph of function \( p \).

Based on the graph and the situation, which domain and range make sense for function \( p \)?

answer.answertext: Domain: all numbers from 0 to 85. Range: all numbers from 0 to 14.
Domain: whole numbers only from 0 to 14. Range: whole numbers only from 0 to 85.
Domain: all numbers from 0 to 14. Range: whole numbers only from 0 to 85.
Domain: whole numbers only from 0 to 14. Range: all numbers from 0 to 85.

question.name: A child ate 30 grams of cereal for breakfast
question.questiontext:
1. A child ate 30 grams of cereal for breakfast and her brother ate 40% more than that. How many grams of cereal did the brother eat?
  2. A pair of shoes that normally cost $30 have their price reduced by 25%. What is the sale price of the shoes?

question.name: The table shows several points that lie along a line when plotted on a coordinate plane.
question.questiontext:

question.name: True or False?
question.questiontext:
Decide whether each equation is true or false. If false, write a corrected (true) equation by modifying the number or expression on the right side of the equal sign. (There may be more than one way to correct the equation so that it is true.)

  1. \( 4^3 = 4 + 4 + 4 \)
  2. \( \frac14 \cdot \frac14 = \left(\frac14\right)^2 \)
  3. \( x \cdot x \cdot x \cdot x \cdot x = 5x \)
  4. \( 3^2 = 2 \cdot 2 \cdot 2 \)
  5. \( 9^2 = 3^4 \)
  6. \( \frac{1}{b} \cdot \frac{1}{b} \cdot \frac{1}{b} \cdot \frac{1}{b} = \left(\frac{1}{b}\right)^4 \)

question.questiontext:

answer.answertext: \( g(12) \) represents the temperature at noon.
The maximum temperature shown on the graph happens at 3:00 p.m.

question.name: An artist posted a music video online.
question.questiontext:
Jada saw a music video that her favorite artist recently posted online. The equation \( v(t)=320 \cdot 4^t \) represents the number of views \( v \) of the video, \( t \) days since Jada saw the video.

  1. Find \( v(\text-2) \).
  2. What does \( v(\text-2) \) represent in this situation?

question.name: A new online music service has a collection of 1,500 songs.
question.questiontext:
A new online music service has a collection of 1,500 songs. It expects to triple the number of songs each year for the next few years.

Write an equation representing the relationship, where \( x \) is time in years, and \( y \) is the number of songs available.

question.name: Aspirin in the Body
question.questiontext:
The milligrams of aspirin in a person's body is given by the equation \( a = 500 \cdot \left(\frac{3}{4}\right)^t \), where \( t \) is the number of hours since the patient took the medicine.

  1. How much aspirin will be in the patient's body after two hours?
  2. In the equation, what does the 500 tell us about the situation?
  3. In the equation, what does the \( \frac{3}{4} \) tell us about the situation?
  4. Graph the equation for values of \( t \) between 0 and 4.

question.name: For the equation $y = 8 \boldcdot 2^x$ complete the table and plot the ordered pairs on the graph.

\( x \) -3 -2 -1 0 1 2 3
\( y \)

question.questiontext: A new computer loses \( \frac13 \) of its value every year. Which graph could represent the relationship between the year and the computer's value?

question.questiontext: These equations represent the number of bacteria in four different dishes as a function of time, \( t \), in days. Which equation represents the population with the greatest growth factor?

round0123\( n \)

question.name: Books at the library
question.questiontext:
At the beginning of the year, the number of books owned by a library was 10,000. Since then, it has grown by 1% each month.

Which expressions represent the number of books, in thousands, owned by the library 5 years later if it continues to grow at that rate?

question.name: For which function does $f$ decrease by 15% every time $x$ increases by 1?
question.questiontext: For which function does \( f \) decrease by 15% every time \( x \) increases by 1?

question.name: The population of a city increases by 5% every year.
question.questiontext: The population of a city increases by 5% every year. If its population today is 300,000, what will its population be in 2 years?

question.name: 18th Birthday Gift
question.questiontext:
When a child is born, her grandfather decides to put $100 in an account that earns interest. He plans to make no other deposits or withdrawals for 18 years. When the child turns 18 years old, the money in the account will be a birthday gift. The grandfather is choosing between two options:

  • Option 1: An account that grows by 10.5% each year.
  • Option 2: An account that grows by $20 each year.

Which option will result in a better 18th birthday gift? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: A savings account earns 8% interest each year, compounded quarterly (4 times a year).
question.questiontext: A savings account earns 8% interest each year, compounded quarterly (4 times a year). If a person invests $100 and makes no further deposits or withdrawals, what is the balance in the account after 3 years?

question.name: Here is the graph of $f(x)=5.4321 \boldcdot 2^x$.

The coordinates of \( A \) are \( (1,c) \) and the coordinates of \( B \) are \( (4,d) \). What is the value of \( \frac{d}{c} \)? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: The function $c(x)=72 \boldcdot (1.04)^x$ models the cost in dollars, $c$, of 1 ounce a certain chemical used in a laboratory.
question.questiontext:
The function \( c(x)=72 \cdot (1.04)^x \) models the cost in dollars, \( c \), of 1 ounce of a certain chemical used in a laboratory. \( x \) represents the number of years since 2010.

  1. Does the cost of the chemical increase or decrease over time, and by what percentage per year does it do so?
  2. How much does an ounce of the chemical cost in 2018? Show your reasoning.

question.name: Which expression is equal to \(815 – 97\)?
question.questiontext: Which expression is equal to \( 815 - 97 \)?

question.name: A train is traveling at a constant speed of 44...
question.questiontext:
A train is traveling at a constant speed of 44 feet per second. At a checkpoint along the route of the train, a sensor detects when the front of the train passes the checkpoint. At that moment, a stopwatch is started.

  1. Complete the table with the distance between the checkpoint and the front of the train at each time on the stopwatch.
    time on the stopwatch (seconds)distance from checkpoint (feet)
    0
    1
    2
    3
    4
  2. Write an expression to represent the distance (feet) of the front of the train from the checkpoint as a function of \( t \), the time (seconds) on the stopwatch.
  3. Station Q is 5,000 feet past the checkpoint. How far from Station Q is the front of the train when the stopwatch shows 4 seconds? What about when the stopwatch shows 15 seconds?
  4. Write an expression to represent the distance (feet) of the front of the train from Station Q as a function of \( t \), the time (seconds) on the stopwatch.

question.name: A wall is covered with 6 wood panels
question.questiontext:

  2. A rectangle has a length of 6 centimeters and a width of \( x+10 \) centimeters. Write an expression to represent the rectangle's:

    1. perimeter (centimeters)
    2. area (square centimeters)

  4. \( 5a - 10ab \)

question.name: Han bought a \$15 bus pass. Each bus ride costs...
question.questiontext:
Han bought a $15 bus pass. Each bus ride costs $1.50.

  1. The expression \( 15-1.50r \) represents the dollar amount left in Han's bus pass after \( r \) rides. Explain what the 15, -1.50, and \( \text-1.50r \) in the expression mean in this situation.
  2. Show that the expression \( 1.50(10-r) \) is equivalent to \( 15-1.50r \).
  3. Explain what the 1.50, 10, and \( (10-r) \) in the expression \( 1.50(10-r) \) mean in this situation.

question.name: Lin is standing on a beach, and throws a rock...
question.questiontext:
Andre is standing on a beach, and throws a rock up in the air so that it will land in the ocean.

The graph shows the height of the rock, in feet, above the water as a function of time, in seconds.

  1. How high above the water was the rock when Andre threw it? Explain how you know.
  2. When did the rock reach its maximum height? How high was it?
  3. About when did the rock hit the ocean?

question.name: The graph represents the equation \(y = \text-3x + 6\)....
question.questiontext:

  1. Explain how you can use the equation to tell that the point \( (5,\text-9) \) is on the graph.
  2. What is the \( y \)-intercept of the graph? How is the \( y \)-intercept related to the equation?
  3. What is the \( x \)-intercept of the graph? How is the \( x \)-intercept related to the equation?

question.name: A company finds that if it charges \(x\) dollars for...
question.questiontext:
A company finds that if it charges \( x \) dollars for a cell phone, it can expect to sell \( 1,\!000-2x \) phones. The company uses the function \( r \) defined by \( r(x)=x \cdot (1,000-2x) \) to model the expected revenue, in dollars, from selling cell phones at \( x \) dollars each.

  1. Use graphing technology to graph the function \( r \). Sketch the graph here and show the coordinates of the vertex and any intercepts.
  2. What do the \( x \)-intercepts mean in this situation?
  3. Is \( 0 \leq x \leq 600 \) an appropriate domain for the function \( r \)? Explain your reasoning.
  4. At what price should the company sell their phones to get the maximum revenue? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: An elementary school is building a rectangular play area against...
question.questiontext:
A school is constructing a rectangular play area against an exterior wall of the school building. It uses 120 feet of fencing material to enclose three sides of the play area.

  1. Complete the table by giving the length and area for each width. (The width is the side perpendicular to the building.)
    width (feet)length (feet)area (square feet)
    10
    30
    40
    \( w \)
  2. Write an equation to represent \( \ell \), the length of the play area in feet, as a function of \( w \), the width in feet.
  3. Write an equation to represent \( A \), the area in square feet, as a function of \( w \), the width in feet.

question.name: For each expression, apply the distributive property and write an...

question.name: Priya is comparing two functions: \(f(x) = 10 \boldcdot x^2\)...
question.questiontext:
Priya is comparing two functions: \( f(x) = 10 \cdot x^2 \) and \( g(x) = 3 \cdot 2^x \) to find out which one has greater output values as \( x \) gets very large.

She notices that \( f(1)=10 \) and \( f(2)=40 \). However, \( g(1)=6 \) and \( g(2)=12 \). She concludes that as \( x \) continues to grow, the values of \( f \) will be greater than the values of \( g \) .

Explain or show why Priya's conclusion is incorrect.

question.name: An orange is shot up into the air with a...
question.questiontext:
An orange is shot up into the air with a catapult. The function \( h \) given by \( h(t)=15+60t-16t^2 \) models the orange's height, in feet, \( t \) seconds after it was launched.

Select all the true statements about the situation.

answer.answertext: The domain of function \( h \) only contains values greater than or equal to 0.
The orange is at the same height 1 second after launch and 2 seconds after launch.
The orange has hit the ground at 3 seconds.
The orange is 15 feet above the ground when it is launched.
The value \( t = 10 \) does not belong to the domain of \( h \).

question.name: 1.15.6 That data set has a (Clone 1)
question.questiontext:
Here are the statistics for the high temperatures in a city during October:

  • mean of 65.3 degrees Fahrenheit
  • median of 63.5 degrees Fahrenheit
  • standard deviation of 9.3 degrees Fahrenheit
  • IQR of 7.1 degeres Fahrenheit

Recall that the temperature \( C \), measured in degrees Celsius, is related to the temperature \( F \), measured in degrees Fahrenheit, by \( C = \frac{5}{9}\left(F - 32\right) \).

  1. Describe how the value of each statistic changes when 32 is subtracted from the temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.
  2. Describe how the value of each statistic further changes when the new values are multiplied by \( \frac{5}{9} \).
  3. Describe how to find the value of each statistic when the temperature is measured in degrees Celsius.

question.questiontext: A set of data has MAD 0 and one of the data values is 14. What can you say about the data values?

question.name: 2.1.7 Clone 1 of Donut Shop
question.questiontext:
Each of the 10 students in the baking club made 2 chocolate cakes for a fundraiser. They all used the same recipe, using \( C \) cups of flour in total.

Write an expression that represents the amount of flour required for one cake.

question.name: 1.9.4 What is the mean of {10,...
question.questiontext: The value of coins in the pockets of several students is recorded. What is the mean of the values: 10, 20, 35, 35, 35, 40, 45, 45, 50, 60

question.name: 2.1.4 Videography Contest
question.questiontext:
The videography team entered a contest and won a monetary prize of $1,350.

Which expression represents how much each person would get if there were \( x \) people on the team?

question.name: 2.1.9 Clone 1 of What are the Constraints?
question.questiontext:
A softball team is ordering pizza to eat after their tournament. They plan to order cheese pizzas that cost $6 each and four-topping pizzas that cost $10 each. They order \( c \) cheese pizzas and \( f \) four-topping pizzas.

Which expression represents the total cost of all of the pizzas they order?

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.A3 Cumulative Pp Set For Writing Equations To Model Relationships (Part 2)'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.A3 Cumulative Pp Set For Writing Equations To Model Relationships (Part 2)'.

question.name: 1.10.4 The data set represent the number...
question.questiontext:
The data show the number of free throws attempted by a team in its first ten games.

  • 2
  • 11
  • 11
  • 11
  • 12
  • 12
  • 13
  • 14
  • 14
  • 15

The median is 12 attempts and the mean is 11.5 attempts. After reviewing the data, it is determined that 2 should not be included, since that was an exhibition game rather than a regular game during the season.

  1. What happens to the median if 2 attempts is removed from the data set?
  2. What happens to the mean if 2 attempts is removed from the data set?

question.name: 1.12.7 Clone 2 for first pp with standard deviation 0
question.questiontext: The standard deviation for a data set is 0. What can you conclude about the data?

question.name: 2.2.3 An object’s density can be found...
question.questiontext:
The density of an object can be found by taking its mass and dividing by its volume.

Write an equation to represent the relationship between the three quantities (density, mass, and volume) in each situation. Let the density, \( D \), be measured in grams/cubic centimeters (or g/cm3).

  1. The mass is 500 grams and the volume is 40 cubic centimeters.
  2. The mass is 125 grams and the volume is \( v \) cubic centimeters.
  3. The volume is 1.4 cubic centimeters and the density is 80 grams per cubic centimeter.
  4. The mass is \( m \) grams and the volume is \( v \) cubic centimeters.

question.name: 2.2.9 Clone 2 of Density
question.questiontext:
Elena has $225 in her bank account. She takes out $20 each week for \( w \) weeks. After \( w \) weeks she has \( d \) dollars left in her bank account.

Write an equation that represents the amount of money left in her bank account after \( w \) weeks.

question.name: 2.3.6 Equation from a situation 2
question.questiontext:
Tyler needs to complete this table for his consumer science class. He knows that 1 tablespoon contains 3 teaspoons and that 1 cup contains 16 tablespoons.

number of teaspoonsnumber of tablespoonsnumber of cups
2
3612
483
  1. Complete the missing values in the table.
  2. Write an equation that represents the number of teaspoons, \( t \), contained in a cup, \( C \).

question.name: 2.3.7 Clone of cubits and paces
question.questiontext:
The volume of dry goods, like apples or peaches, can be measured usings bushels, pecks, and quarts. A bushel contains 4 pecks, and a peck contains 8 quarts.

What is the relationship between number of bushels, \( b \), and the number of quarts, \( q \)? If you get stuck, try creating a table.

question.name: 2.2.4 Clone 1 of Milk and Cookies
question.questiontext:
Priya is hosting a poetry club meeting this week and plans to have fruit punch and cheese for the meeting. She is preparing 8 ounces of fruit punch per person and 2 ounces of cheese per person. Including herself, there are 12 people in the club.

A package of cheese contains 16 ounces and costs $3.99. A one-gallon jug of fruit punch contains 128 ounces and costs $2.50. Let \( p \) represent number of people in the club, \( f \) represent the ounces of fruit punch, \( c \) represent the ounces of cheese, and \( b \) represent Priya's budget in dollars.

Select all of the equations that could represent the quantities and constraints in this situation.

question.name: 2.3.1 Clone 1 of Volume
question.questiontext:
A landscaping company is delivering crushed stone to a construction site. The table shows the total weight in pounds, \( W \), of \( n \) loads of crushed stone.

Which equation could represent the total weight, in pounds, for \( n \) loads of crushed stone?

number of loads

of crushed stone		total weight in pounds
00
12,000
24,000
36,000

question.name: 2.3.5 Equation from a situation
question.questiontext:
Members of the band sold juice and popcorn at a college football game to raise money for an upcoming trip. The band raised $2,000. The amount raised is divided equally among the \( m \) members of the band.

Which equation represents the amount, \( A \), each member receives?

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.A4 Cumulative Pp Set For Equations And Their Solutions'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.A4 Cumulative Pp Set For Equations And Their Solutions'.

question.name: 2.4.3 Diego's Dimes & Nickels
question.questiontext:
Diego is collecting dimes and nickels in a jar. He has collected $22.25 so far. The relationship between the numbers of dimes and nickels, and the amount of money in dollars is represented by the equation \( 0.10d+0.05n=22.25 \).

Select all the values \( (d,n) \) that could be solutions to the equation.

question.name: 1.10.7 The box plot represents the (clone 1)
question.questiontext:
The box plot represents the distribution of the number of children in 30 different familes.

After further examination, the value of 12 is removed for having been recorded in error. The box plot represents the distribution of the same data set, but with the maximum, 12, removed.

The median is 2 children for both plots.

  1. Explain why the median remains the same when 12 was removed from the data set.
  2. When 12 is removed from the data set, does mean remain the same? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 1.13.7 The widths in millimeters (Clone 2)
question.questiontext:
The number of points Jada's basketball team scored in their games have a mean of about 44 and a standard deviation of about 15.7 points.

Interpret the mean and standard deviation in the context of Jada's basketball team.

question.name: 2.2.8 Clone 1 of an Object's Density
question.questiontext:
The speed of an object can be found by taking the distance it travels and dividing it by the time it takes to travel that distance. An object travels 100 feet in 2.5 seconds. Let the speed, \( S \), be measured in feet per second.

Write an equation to represent the relationship between the three quantities (speed, distance, and time).

question.name: 2.4.2 T-Shirt for Drama Club
question.questiontext:
The drama club is printing t-shirts for its members. The printing company charges a certain amount for each shirt plus a setup fee of $40. There are 21 students in the drama club.

  1. If there are 21 students in the club and the t-shirt order costs a total of $187, how much does each t-shirt cost? Show your reasoning.
  2. The equation \( 201.50 = f + 6.50(21) \) represents the cost of printing the shirts at a second printing company. Find the solution to the equation and state what it represents in this situation.

question.name: 2.1.3 Donut Shop
question.questiontext:
A donut shop made 12 dozen donuts to give to a school's math club.

Which expression represents how many donuts each student would get if the donuts were equally distributed and there were \( x \) students in math club?

question.name: 2.2.5 Clone 2 of Milk and Cookies
question.questiontext:
Kiran's family is having people over to watch a football game. They plan to serve sparkling water and pretzels. They are preparing 12 ounces of sparkling water and 3 ounces of pretzels per person. Including Kiran's family, there will be 10 people at the gathering.

A bottle of sparkling water contains 22 ounces and costs $1.50. A package of pretzels contains 16 ounces and costs $2.99. Let \( n \) represent number of people watching the football game, \( s \) represent the ounces of sparkling water, \( p \) represent the ounces of pretzels, and \( b \) represent Kiran's budget in dollars. Which equation best represents Kiran's budget?

question.name: 2.4.4 Volunteer Drivers of Cars and Vans (Part 1)
question.questiontext:
Volunteer drivers are needed to bring 80 students to the championship baseball game. Drivers either have cars, which can seat 4 students, or vans, which can seat 6 students. The equation \( 4c + 6v=80 \) describes the relationship between the number of cars, \( c \), and number of vans, \( v \), that can transport exactly 80 students.

Select all statements that are true about the situation.

answer.answertext: If 12 cars go, then 2 vans are needed.
\( c=14 \) and \( v=4 \) are a pair of solutions to the equation.
If 6 cars go and 11 vans go, there will be extra space.
10 cars and 8 vans isn't enough to transport all the students.
If 20 cars go, no vans are needed.
8 vans and 8 cars are numbers that meet the constraints in this situation.

question.name: 2.4.5 Clone 1 of Grapes Problem
question.questiontext:
An artist is selling children's crafts. Necklaces cost $2.25 each, and bracelets cost $1.50 per each.

Select all the combinations of necklaces and bracelets that the artist could sell for exactly $12.00.

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.A5 Cumulative Pp Set For Equations And Their Graphs'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.A5 Cumulative Pp Set For Equations And Their Graphs'.

question.name: 1.13.8 One population of mountain gorillas (Clone 1)
question.questiontext:
During the month of August, the mean of the daily rainfall in one city was 0.04 inches with a standard deviation of 0.15 inches. In another city, the mean of the daily rainfall was 0.01 inches with a standard deviation of 0.05 inches.

Han says that both cities had a similar pattern of precipitation in the month of August. Do you agree with Han? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.1.1 Teams in a Game
question.questiontext:
In a video game, players form teams and work together to earn as many points as possible for their team. Each team can have between 2 and 4 players. Each player can score up to 20 points in each round of the game. Han and three of his friends decided to form a team and play a round.

Write an expression, an equation, or an inequality for each quantity described here. If you use a variable, specify what it represents.

  1. the allowable number of players on a team
  2. the number of points Han's team earns in one round if every player earns a perfect score
  3. the number of points Han's team earns in one round if no players earn a perfect score
  4. the number of players in a game with six teams of different sizes: two teams have 4 players each and the rest have 3 players each
  5. the possible number of players in a game with eight teams

question.name: 2.2.2 A cross-country team is doing a...
question.questiontext:
A student on the cross-country team runs 30 minutes a day as a part of her training.

Write an equation to describe the relationship between the distance she runs in miles, \( D \), and her running speed, in miles per hour, when she runs:

  1. at a constant speed of 4 miles per hour for the entire 30 minutes
  2. at a constant speed of 5 miles per hour the first 20 minutes, and then at 4 miles per hour the last 10 minutes
  3. at a constant speed of 6 miles per hour the first 15 minutes, and then at 5.5 miles per hour for the remaining 15 minutes
  4. at a constant speed of \( a \) miles per hour the first 6 minutes, and then at 6.5 miles per hour for the remaining 24 minutes
  5. at a constant speed of 5.4 miles per hour for \( m \) minutes, and then at \( b \) miles per hour for \( n \) minutes

question.name: 2.3.4 Hands, cubits, and paces
question.questiontext:
In the 21st century, people measure length in feet and meters. At various points in history, people measured length in hands, cubits, and paces. There are 9 hands in 2 cubits. There are 5 cubits in 3 paces.

  1. Write an equation to express the relationship between hands, \( h \), and cubits, \( c \).
  2. Write an equation to express the relationship between hands, \( h \), and paces, \( p \).

question.name: 2.5.10 Money and Time - Bank Account
question.questiontext:
Technology required. Priya starts with $50 in her bank account. She then deposits $20 each week for 12 weeks.

  1. Write an equation that represents the relationship between the dollar amount in her bank account and the number of weeks of saving.
  2. Graph your equation using graphing technology. Mark the point on the graph that represents the amount after 3 weeks.
  3. How many weeks does it take her to have $250 in her bank account? Mark this point on the graph.

question.name: 2.5.9 Interpreting a point in a situation
question.questiontext:
A theater is selling tickets to a play. Adult tickets cost $8 each and children's tickets cost $5 each. They collect $275 after selling \( x \) adult tickets and \( y \) children's tickets.

What does the point \( (30, 7) \) mean in this situation?

question.name: 2.3.2 Clone 3 of Volume
question.questiontext:
The table shows the amount of money, \( A \), in a savings account after \( m \) months.

Select all the equations that represent the relationship between the amount of money, \( A \), and the number of months, \( m \).

number of monthsdollar amount
51,200
61,300
71,400
81,500

question.name: 2.5.7 All the Points on a Line
question.questiontext: Select all the points that are on the graph of the equation \( 4y-6x=12 \).

question.name: 2.5.8 Points on a Graph
question.questiontext:
Here is a graph of the equation \( x+3y = 6 \).

Select all coordinate pairs that represent a solution to the equation.

question.name: 2.6.3 Clone 1 Which are equivalent
question.questiontext: Which equation is equivalent to the equation \( 6x + 9 = 12 \)?

question.questiontext: Select all the equations that have the same solution as \( 2x - 5 = 15 \).

question.name: 2.6.2 Common Solution
question.questiontext: Select all the equations that have the same solution as the equation \( 3x-12=24 \).

question.name: 1.14.5 The mean is...
question.questiontext:
The number of hours spent in an airplane on a single flight is recorded on a dot plot. The mean is 5 hours and the standard deviation is approximately 5.82 hours. The median is 4 hours and the IQR is 3 hours. The value 26 hours is an outlier that should not have been included in the data.

When the outlier is removed from the data set:

  1. What is the mean?
  2. What is the standard deviation?
  3. What is the median?
  4. What is the IQR?

question.name: 2.3.8 Clone 4 of volume (bananas)
question.questiontext:
A basketball coach purchases bananas for the players on his team. The table shows total price in dollars, \( P \), of \( n \) bananas.

Which equation could represent the total price in dollars for \( n \) bananas?

number of bananastotal price in dollars
74.13

question.name: 2.4.9 Dimes and Quarters
question.questiontext:
Kiran is collecting dimes and quarters in a jar. He has collected $10.00 so far and has \( d \) dimes and \( q \) quarters. The relationship between the numbers of dimes and quarters, and the amount of money in dollars is represented by the equation \( 0.1d + 0.25q = 10 \).

Select all the values \( (d, q) \) that could be solutions to the equation.

question.name: 2.5.1 Select All Solutions
question.questiontext:
Here is a graph of the equation \( 3x-2y=12 \).

Select all coordinate pairs that represent a solution to the equation.

question.name: 2.5.2 Strawberry Jam
question.questiontext:
Jada bought some sugar and strawberries to make strawberry jam. Sugar costs $1.80 per pound, and strawberries cost $2.50 per pound. Jada spent a total of $19.40.

Which point on the coordinate plane could represent the pounds of sugar and strawberries that Jada used to make jam?

question.name: 2.6.8 Collecting coins
question.questiontext:
Jada has a coin jar containing \( n \) nickels and \( d \) dimes worth a total of $3.65. The equation \( 0.05n + 0.1d = 3.65 \) is one way to represent this situation.

Which equation is equivalent to the equation \( 0.05n + 0.1d = 3.65 \)?

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.B7 Cumulative Pp Set For Explaining Steps For Rewriting Equations'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.B7 Cumulative Pp Set For Explaining Steps For Rewriting Equations'.

question.name: 2.4.7 Cost for T-shirts
question.questiontext:
The environmental science club is printing T-shirts for its 15 members. The printing company charges a certain amount for each shirt plus a setup fee of $20.

If the T-shirt order costs a total of $162.50, how much does the company charge for each shirt?

question.name: 2.5.3 Celsius Fahrenheit
question.questiontext:
The graph shows the relationship between temperature in degrees Celsius and temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.

  1. Mark the point on the graph that shows the temperature in Celsius when it is 60 degrees Fahrenheit.
  2. Mark the point on the graph that shows the temperature in Fahrenheit when it is 60 degrees Celsius.
  3. Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius. Use the graph to approximate the boiling temperature in Fahrenheit, or to confirm it, if you knew what it is.
  4. The equation that converts Fahrenheit to Celsius is \( C = \frac59 (F-32) \). Use it to calculate the temperature in Celsius when it is 60 degrees Fahrenheit. (This answer will be more exact than the point you found in the first part.)

question.name: 2.7.2 Clone 1 of “Why is it true?”
question.questiontext:
Kiran says that a solution to the equation \( x + 4 = 20 \) must also be a solution to the equation \( 5(x + 4)= 100 \).

Write a convincing explanation as to why this is true.

question.name: 2.7.9 Explaining 2x = 4x
question.questiontext: Is 0 a solution to \( 2x+10 = 4x+10 \)? Explain or show your reasoning.

question.name: 2.4.8 Entrepreneurship club
question.questiontext:
The entrepreneurship club is ordering potted plants for all 36 of its sponsors. One store charges $8.50 for each plant plus a delivery fee of $20. The equation \( 320 = x + 7.50(36) \) represents the cost of ordering potted plants at a second store.

What does the \( x \) represent in this situation?

answer.answertext: The cost for each potted plant at the second store
The delivery fee at the second store
The total cost of ordering potted plants at the second store
The number of sponsors of the entrepreneurship club

question.name: 2.6.10 Diego's age
question.questiontext: Diego's age \( d \) is 5 more than 2 times his sister's age \( s \). This situation is represented by the equation \( d = 2s + 5 \). Which equation is equivalent to the equation \( d = 2s + 5 \)?

question.name: 2.6.4 Clone 2 Which are equivalent
question.questiontext: Which equation is equivalent to the equation \( 5x + 30 = 45 \)?

question.name: 2.6.6 Clone of Common Solution
question.questiontext: Select all the equations that have the same solution as \( 2x - 5 = 15 \).

question.name: 2.7.4 Clone 1 of Explaining Acceptable moves
question.questiontext:
Mai says that equations A and B have the same solution.

  • Equation A: \( \text-3(x + 7) = 24 \)
  • Equation B: \( x + 7 = \text-8 \)

Which statement explains why this is true?

answer.answertext: Adding 3 to both sides of Equation A gives \( x + 7 = \text-8 \).
Applying the distributive property to Equation A gives \( x + 7 = \text-8 \).
Subtracting 3 from both sides of Equation A gives \( x + 7 = \text-8 \).
Dividing both sides of Equation A by -3 gives \( x + 7 = \text-8 \).

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.B8 Cumulative Pp Set For Which Variable To Solve For? (Part 1)'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.B8 Cumulative Pp Set For Which Variable To Solve For? (Part 1)'.

question.name: 2.4.10 Students and adults on a bus
question.questiontext:
A group of 280 elementary school students and 40 adults are going on a field trip. They are planning to use two different types of buses to get to the destination. The first type of bus holds 50 people and the second type of bus holds 56 people.

Andre says that 3 of the first type of bus and 3 of the second type of bus will hold all of the students and adults going on the field trip. Is Andre correct? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.7.5 Clone 1 of the previous problem modeled after Explaining Acceptable moves
question.questiontext:
Elena says that equations A and B are not equivalent.

  • Equation A: \( 13 - 5x = 48 \)
  • Equation B: \( 5x = 35 \)

Write a convincing explanation as to why this is true.

question.name: 2.8.1 Raisins & Almonds
question.questiontext:
Priya is buying raisins and almonds to make trail mix. Almonds cost $5.20 per pound and raisins cost $2.75 per pound. Priya spent $11.70 buying almonds and raisins. The relationship between pounds of almonds \( a \), pounds of raisins \( r \), and the total cost is represented by the equation \( 5.20a+2.75r=11.70 \).

How many pounds of raisins did Priya buy if she bought the following amounts of almonds:

  1. 2 pounds of almonds
  2. 1.06 pounds of almonds
  3. 0.64 pounds of almonds
  4. \( a \) pounds of almonds

question.name: 2.8.2 Traveling Car
question.questiontext:
A car traveled 180 miles at a constant rate.

  1. Complete the table to show the rate at which the car was traveling if it completed the same distance in each number of hours.
  2. Write an equation that would make it easy to find the rate at which the car was traveling in miles per hour \( r \), if it traveled for \( t \) hours.
travel time

(hours)		rate of travel

(miles per hour)
5
4.5
3
2.25

question.name: 2.8.3 Chicken & Ribs
question.questiontext:
A chef bought $17.01 worth of ribs and chicken. Ribs cost 1.89 per pound and chicken costs 0.90 per pound. The equation \( 0.9c+1.89r=17.01 \) represents the relationship between the quantities in this situation.

Show that each of the following equations is equivalent to \( 0.9c+1.89r=17.01 \). Then, explain when it might be helpful to write the equation in these forms.

  1. \( c = 18.9 - 2.1r \)
  2. \( r=\text-\frac{10}{21}c +9 \)

question.name: 2.8.4 Solving for $x$ and $y$
question.questiontext:
Here is a linear equation in two variables: \( 2x+4y-31=123 \).

Solve the equation, first for \( x \) and then for \( y \).

question.name: 2.4.6 Clone 2 of Grapes Problem
question.questiontext:
Bananas cost $0.50 each, and apples cost $1.00 each.

Select all the combinations of bananas and apples that Elena could buy for exactly $3.50.

question.name: 2.6.5 Clone 3 of Which is equiv...
question.questiontext: Select all the equations that are equivalent to the equation \( 3x - 4 = 5 \).

question.name: 2.7.6 Acceptable steps...
question.questiontext:
Han is solving an equation. He took steps that are acceptable but ended up with equations that are clearly not true.

\( \begin {align} 5x + 6 &= 7x + 5 - 2x &\quad& \text{original equation}\\ 5x + 6 &= 7x - 2x + 5 &\quad& \text{apply the commutative property}\\ 5x + 6 &= 5x + 5 &\quad& \text{combine like terms}\\ 6 &= 5&\quad& \text{subtract }5x \text{ from each side} \end {align} \)

What can Han conclude as a result of these acceptable steps?

answer.answertext: There's no value of \( x \) that can make the equation \( 5x + 6 = 7x + 5 - 2x \) true.
Any value of \( x \) can make the equation \( 5x + 6 = 7x + 5 - 2x \) true.
\( x = 6 \) is a solution to the equation \( 5x + 6 = 7x + 5 - 2x \).
\( x = 5 \) is a solution to the equation \( 5x + 6 = 7x + 5 - 2x \).

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.B9 Cumulative Pp Set For Which Variable To Solve For? (Part 2)'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.B9 Cumulative Pp Set For Which Variable To Solve For? (Part 2)'.

question.name: 1.14.10 The data set represents the number of hours (Clone 1)
question.questiontext:
The data represents the number of hours 10 students slept on Sunday night.

  • 6
  • 6
  • 7
  • 7
  • 7
  • 8
  • 8
  • 8
  • 8
  • 9

Are there any outliers? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.9.7 Volume and Height of a Cylinder
question.questiontext:
\( V=\pi r^2h \) is an equation to calculate the volume of a cylinder, \( V \), where \( r \) represents the radius of the cylinder and \( h \) represents its height.

Which equation allows us to easily find the height of the cylinder because it is solved for \( h \)?

question.name: 2.5.4 Seating for a Wedding
question.questiontext:
A catering company is setting up for a wedding. They expect 150 people to attend. They can provide small tables that seat 6 people and large tables that seat 10 people.

  1. Find a combination of small and large tables that seats exactly 150 people.
  2. Let \( x \) represent the number of small tables and \( y \) represent the number of large tables. Write an equation to represent the relationship between \( x \) and \( y \).
  3. Explain what the point \( (20,5) \) means in this situation.
  4. Is the point \( (20,5) \) a solution to the equation you wrote? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.7.3 Clone 2 of “Why is it true”
question.questiontext:
Lin says that a solution to the equation \( 2x - 6 = 7x \) must also be a solution to the equation \( 5x - 6= 10x \).

Write a convincing explanation about why this is true.

question.name: 2.9.10 Width in terms of area and length...
question.questiontext:
The area \( A \) of a rectangle is represented by the formula \( A = lw \) where \( l \) is the length and \( w \) is the width. The length of the rectangle is 5.

Write an equation that makes it easy to find the width of the rectangle if we know the area and the length.

question.name: 2.9.2 Gas Mileage
question.questiontext:
A car has a 16-gallon fuel tank. When driven on a highway, it has a gas mileage of 30 miles per gallon. The gas mileage (also called "fuel efficiency") tells us the number of miles the car can travel for a particular amount of fuel (one gallon of gasoline, in this case). After filling the gas tank, the driver got on a highway and drove for a while.

  1. How many miles has the car traveled if it has the following amounts of gas left in the tank?

    1. 15 gallons
    2. 10 gallons
    3. 2.5 gallons
  2. Write an equation that represents the relationship between the distance the car has traveled in miles, \( d \), and the amount of gas left in the tank in gallons, \( x \).

  3. How many gallons are left in the tank when the car has traveled the following distances on the highway?

    1. 90 miles
    2. 246 miles
  4. Write an equation that makes it easier to find the the amount of gas left in the tank, \( x \), if we know the car has traveled \( d \) miles.

question.name: 2.4.12 Clone 2 of volume (water in the pool)
question.questiontext:
The table shows the volume of water in cubic meters, \( V \), in a tank after water has been pumped out for a certain number of minutes.

Which equation could represent the volume of water in cubic meters after \( t \) minutes of water being pumped out?

time after

pumping begins

volume of water

(cubic meters)

030
527.5

157.5

question.name: 2.6.7 Clone 2 for common solution
question.questiontext: Which equation has the same solution as \( 10x - x + 5 = 41 \)?

question.name: 2.7.7 Clone 2 of the previous problem modeled after Explaining Acceptable moves
question.questiontext:
Noah is solving an equation and one of his moves is unacceptable. Here are the moves he made.

\( \begin {align} 2(x + 6) - 4 &= 8 +6x &\quad& \text {original equation}\\ 2x + 12 - 4 &= 8 + 6x &\quad& \text{apply the distributive property}\\ 2x + 8 &= 8 + 6x &\quad& \text{combine like terms}\\ 2x &= 6x &\quad& \text{subtract 8 from both sides}\\ 2 &= 6 &\quad& \text{divide each side by } x \end {align} \)

Which answer best explains why the "divide each side by \( x \) step" is unacceptable?

answer.answertext: When you divide both sides of \( 2x = 6x \) by \( x \) you get \( 2x^2 = 6x^2 \).
When you divide both sides of \( 2x = 6x \) by \( x \) it could lead us to think that there is no solution while in fact the solution is \( x = 0 \).
When you divide both sides of \( 2x = 6x \) by \( x \) you get \( 2 = 6x \).
When you divide both sides of \( 2x = 6x \) by \( x \) it could lead us to think that there is no solution while in fact the solution is \( x = 3 \).

question.name: 2.9.5 Money from Sports Game
question.questiontext:
Noah is helping to collect the entry fees at his school's sports game. Student entry costs $2.75 each and adult entry costs $5.25 each. At the end of the game, Diego collected $281.25.

Select all equations that could represent the relationship between the number of students, \( s \), the number of adults, \( a \), and the dollar amount received at the game.

question.name: 1.14.13 Outliers from Summary Stats 2
question.questiontext:
A large company releases summary statistics about the annual salaries for its employees.

meanstandard deviationminimumQ1medianQ3maximum
$63,429$38,439$18,000$50,000$58,000$68,000$350,000

Based on this information, are there any outliers in the data? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.10.2 Priya's Savings Account
question.questiontext:
The graph shows how much money Priya has in her savings account weeks after she started saving on a regular basis.

  1. How much money does Priya have in the account after 10 weeks?
  2. How long did it take her to save $200?
  3. How much money did Priya have in her savings account when she started to save regularly?
  4. Write an equation to represent the dollar amount in her savings account and the number of weeks of saving. Be sure to specify what each variable represents.

question.name: 2.11.1 Which Graph?
question.questiontext: Which graph represents the equation \( 12=3x+4y \)? Explain how you know.

question.name: 2.11.4 Han's Error
question.questiontext:
Han wanted to find the intercepts of the graph of the equation \( 10x+4y=20 \). He decided to put the equation in slope-intercept form first. Here is his work:

\( \displaystyle \begin{align} 10x+4y &= 20 \\ 4y &= 20-10x \\ y &=5-10x \\ \end{align} \)

He concluded that the \( x \)-intercept is \( (\frac12,0) \) and the \( y \)-intercept is \( (0,5) \).

  1. What error did Han make?
  2. What are the \( x \)- and \( y \)-intercepts of the line? Explain or show your reasoning.

question.name: 2.11.8 Finding $y$-intercepts
question.questiontext:
What is the \( y \)-intercept of each equation?

  1. \( y = 6x + 2 \)

  2. \( 10x + 5y = 30 \)

  3. \( y - 6 = 2(3x - 4) \)

question.name: 2.5.6 Coins in Priya's Pocket
question.questiontext:
Clare knows that Priya has a bunch of nickels and dimes in her pocket and that the total amount is $1.25.

  1. Find one possibility for the number of nickels and number of dimes that could be in Priya's pocket.
  2. Write an equation that describes the relationship between the number of dimes and the number of nickels in Priya's pocket.
  3. Explain what the point \( (13,6) \) means in this situation.
  4. Is the point \( (13,6) \) a solution to the equation you wrote? Explain your reasoning.

question.name: 2.10.8 Graphing intercepts...
question.questiontext:
A school sells adult tickets and student tickets for a play. It collects $1,400 in total.

The graph shows the possible combinations of the number of adult tickets sold and the number of student tickets sold.

What does the vertical intercept (0, 200) tell us in this situation?

answer.answertext: It tells us the decrease in the sale of adult tickets for each student ticket sold.
It tells us the decrease in the sale of student tickets for each adult ticket sold.
It tells us that if no adult tickets were sold, then 200 students tickets were sold.
It tells us that if no students tickets were sold, then 200 adult tickets were sold.

question.name: 2.11.7 Find the slope from the equation of a line...
question.questiontext: What is the slope of the graph of \( 5x - 2y = 20 \)?

question.name: 2.6.9 Collecting coins 2
question.questiontext:
Noah has a coin jar containing \( d \) dimes and \( q \) quarters worth a total of $5.00.

Select all the equations that represent this situation.

question.name: 2.9.9 Equivalent equations 1
question.questiontext:
Noah orders an extra-large pizza. It costs $12.49 for the pizza plus $1.50 for each topping. He orders an extra-large pizza with \( t \) toppings that costs a total of \( d \) dollars.

Select all of the equations that represent the relationship between the number of toppings \( t \) and total cost \( d \) of the pizza with \( t \) toppings.

question_category.name: Quiz Bank 'Algebra1.2.C12 Cumulative Pp Set For Writing And Graphing Systems Of Linear Equations'
question_category.info: Questions in quiz 'Algebra1.2.C12 Cumulative Pp Set For Writing And Graphing Systems Of Linear Equations'.

question.name: 2.7.1 Why is it True?
question.questiontext:
Andre does not understand why a solution to the equation \( 3-x=4 \) must also be a solution to the equation \( 12=9-3x \).

Write a convincing explanation as to why this is true.

question.name: 2.11.6 Finding the $x$-intercept
question.questiontext: What is the \( x \)-intercept of the graph of \( y = 3 - 5x \)?

question.name: 2.10.4 Volunteer Drivers of Cars and Vans (Part 2)
question.questiontext:
Volunteer drivers are needed to bring 80 students to the championship baseball game. Drivers either have cars, which can seat 4 students, or vans, which can seat 6 students. The equation \( 4c+6v=80 \) describes the relationship between the number of cars \( c \) and number of vans \( v \) that can transport exactly 80 students.

Explain how you know that this graph represents this equation.

question.name: 2.12.5 A Solution to One, Both, Neither Equation?
question.questiontext:
Here are two equations:

Equation 1: \( 6x+4y=34 \)

Equation 2: \( 5x-2y=15 \)

  1. Decide whether each \( (x,y) \) pair is a solution to one equation, both equations, or neither of the equations.

    1. \( (3 ,4) \)
    2. \( (4, 2.5) \)
    3. \( (5, 5) \)
    4. \( (3, 2) \)
  2. Is it possible to have more than one \( (x,y) \) pair that is a solution to both equations? Explain or show your reasoning.

question.name: 2.12.7 Diego is thinking of two numbers....
question.questiontext:
Diego is thinking of two positive numbers. He says, "If we triple the first number and double the second number, the sum is 34."

  1. Write an equation that represents this clue. Then, find two possible pairs of numbers Diego could be thinking of.

  2. Diego then says, "If we take half of the first number and double the second, the sum is 14."

    Write an equation that could represent this description.

  3. What are Diego's two numbers? Explain or show how you know. A coordinate plane is given here, in case helpful.

question.name: 2.12.8 Show That It's True
question.questiontext: Explain or show that the point \( (5,\text-4) \) is a solution to this system of equations: \( \begin{cases} 3x-2y=23 \\ 2x+y=6 \\ \end{cases} \)

question.name: 2.12.1 Scarves & Hats
question.questiontext:
The knitting club sold 40 scarves and hats at a winter festival and made $700 from the sales. They charged $18 for each scarf and $14 for each hat.

If \( s \) represents the number of scarves sold and \( h \) represents the number of hats sold, which system of equations represents the constraints in this situation?

question.name: 2.4.11 Volume of Water
question.questiontext:
The table shows the volume of water in a tank after it has been filled to a certain height.

Which equation could represent the volume of water in cubic inches, \( V \), when the height is \( h \) inches?

height of water
